results.title: Asthma
results.creator_credit: Marie Meyrick, British Medical Television and Pat Phillips
results.brief_description: Asthma is the most common human ailment except for cold and flu. This excellent and informative video explains the physical and psychological effects of the condition, as well as investigating the range of treatments available for sufferers of asthma. Interviews with health professionals and people living with asthma stress the seriousness of the condition but the video makes clear that with proper treatment, medication and exercise the asthma sufferer can achieve a happy and active life. Produced by medical professionals, this video dispels myths about the disease and treats the asthma sufferer with intelligence and dignity.

results.title: Asteroids, comets and meteorites
results.creator_credit: Herbert Schick and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: This film opens with pictures of man-made satellites and proceeds to show the characteristics of the minor members of the solar system - asteroids, comets and meteorites. Animated diagrams show the ways meteorites, comets and asteroids move in the system. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: Asterix vs Caesar
results.creator_credit: Gaumont, Goscinny, Paul Brizzi and Gaetan Brizzi
results.brief_description: These Romans are crazy! Now they’ve miraculously captured two Gauls and sent them to a Legion camp in the furthest region of the Empire, the Sahara Desert. Asterix and Obelix set off to rescue their Gaulish comrades by joining the legion, only to find that they have already escaped. The search continues and our heroes end up in the Colosseum facing Romans, gladiators and lions galore. All your favourites are back in another Gaulish adventure. Asterix, Obelix, Dogmatix, Chief Vitalstatistix, the druid Getafix, Panacea, and more! Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Uderzo.

results.title: Asterix and Cleopatra
results.creator_credit: Yannik Piel, Gaumont-British Instructional, Dargaud Films and Pino Van Lamsweerde
results.brief_description: Thanks to the magic potion made by a Druid, Asterix the tiny Gaul has mighty powers. With his pal Obelix they make life miserable for the Roman soldiers unlucky enough to live near their village. This adventure finds our heroes in Egypt. The Egyptians are famous for their pyramids, but this doesn’t impress the Romans when every other building in Egypt is in danger of falling down. So when Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, has a blazing row with Julius Caesar, the Roman Emperor, it’s the start of an amazingly funny adventure for Asterix. His task is to build a palace fit for a queen in only a few weeks and win Cleopatra’s bet! Based on the popular books by Goscinny and Underzo.

results.title: Astacus (the crayfish)
results.brief_description: The crayfish is examined as an example of an animal having an external skeleton; the function and structure of each individual part of the skeleton is studied. Detailed consideration is given to the male and female reproductive organs, the arterial system, the nervous system, and the process of feeding and digestion.

results.title: Assorted Film Making Accessories
results.brief_description: “Coated Walz Filter for Color Film housed in original cardboard box. Walz brand clear plastic case with lid and base. Metal rimmed light brown/orange glass lens. Instructions included Kodak Kodachrome 25 colour movie film daylight for 8mm roll (7.5m KM459P) Tin can embossed with Kodak logo on the top. Unused reel of film. Tin sealed together with black duct tape. Original box Envelope Instructions Film price includes processing by Kodak. Mailing envelope enclosed (this has never been used and is folded in a small square) 7.5 metres in length of douible 8mm film on this roll which is intended to yield 15 metres in length of 8mm movies. The additional film at each end serves as leader and trailer for light protection and camera loading. Process before Oct 1979. KM459P CAT 416 9918 Daylight, ASA 25, 15 DIN 2 pairs of mono ear buds to be plugged in to a crystal radio. 1. Brown leather pouch with pink ear bud. 2. Black vinyl puch with cream ear bud. Sunbeam lens brush. Sundry cord in ziplock bag. National brand. Could possibly have been a cord to connect flash. However there doesn’t see to be a donated item which this pairs with. Cyldon brand film reel. (for 8mm) Light metal (tin?). Made in England Markers for 50, 100, 150 and 200 feet.”

results.title: Association Football. Pt. 3. Coaching in the game
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Football Association and George Sturt
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Looks specifically at field positions and strategies of attack and defence. Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Association football. Pt. 2. Trapping
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Football Association and George Sturt
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Demonstrates trapping skills with cushioning, inside and outside of the foot traps, sole and instep traps and trapping on the run. Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Association Football. Pt. 1. Methods of coaching
results.creator_credit: Edward Grossman, Gaumont-British Instructional, Football Association and George Sturt
results.brief_description: Instructional film looking at the skills involved in the game of football (soccer). Shows football players involved in a range of drills including ball control, striking, passing etc. Also includes footage of England vs Wales (c1940s). Commentary by Raymond Glendenning.

results.title: Assistance India : people to people
results.brief_description: This film shows the organization of Community Aid Abroad and the work it does in under-developed countries, particularly India. Enlightened agricultural and irrigation production; a co-operative rural bank has relieved some financial pressures; and education programmes have given hope for the future. Shows the growth of a self supporting leper community. However despite development, traditional Indian cultural pursuits are strongly perpetuated. No other credits available.
